comment: I had Dr.Brown for MGT 3100; he is one of my favorite professors at KSU. Class was participation-based, he loves to interact with his students. He was funny and always cracking jokes. You can make up assignments. Graded on 2 group projects, 2 discussions, and 4 exams, which were fairly easy. Show up to class and participate and you will pass.
He's pretty all over the place ngl just go with another prof at KSU

Brown had the whole class laughing all semester. He's an interesting guy that works in the field. He gives real life context and doesn't work out of the textbook. He's very insightful and holds mainly group discussions. Grades super easy. My only thing with him is that he is very disorganized and does not post things on time. Definitely take him!

Lectures are entertaining and funny. Very few assignments (4 discussions, 3 tests, 1 group project). Although, his schedules and directions are confusing and not organized. Regardless, semi-easy class.

Dr. Brown is a great professor! He has several discussion posts and case studies during the semester, but they are all very easy and straightforward. Make sure to participate in class and you will have a fun semester, he really loves to have class discussion. His tests are also straightforward and he provides you with all the information you need.
